results.title: Elsie
results.brief_description:
Combining 2D art with abstract stylised 3D Elsie’s world is immersive and slightly disturbing as the audience receives a taste of walking in her shoes and seeing with her eyes.
Imagination and reality collide as the race to find the parents she ironically avoids from the evil clutches of her neighbours, the Fenwrights, begins.

results.title: Khalid’s surprise
results.brief_description: Machinima is animating using the 3D real-time virtual worlds of computer games as opposed to the complex, non real-time 3D animation software used by professionals. The game engine used to create this compelling short homage to a highly popular film is Battlefield 2, Battlefield 2: Modern Combat features a propaganda-fuelled single player campaign where gamers play both sides of a conflict in one of the most treacherous regions in the world - Kazakhstan

results.title: I thought I knew but I was wrong: New Video Art from Australia
results.brief_description: I thought I knew but I was wrong: New Video Art From Australia is a proposed collaboration between ACMI and Asialink to tour an exhibition of contemporary Australian video art to selected venues throughout Asia in late 2004- early 2005. The exhibition will be curated by Alexie Glass, ACMI and Sarah Tutton, Asialink, and will include the work of a range of artists and filmmakers.

results.title: Weekends in the country
results.brief_description: Born in the country but forced to live in a hostel for the deaf in Melbourne from a very young age, William talks about his isolation, depression and separation from family. This is a tragic story reflecting the lack of facilities and support for the deaf in rural Victoria. With Auslan signing and subtitles.

results.title: Exhibition formally known as Synthetics (EFKS)
results.brief_description: An exhibition that charts the history of the electronically generated image in Australia from 1969 - 1988 (roughly). Includes case studies by artists whose creative innovations have influenced significantly the evolution of electronic media arts. (see: Documentation for details)

results.title: Synthetics. Volume 4
results.brief_description: Volume 4 of a 4 volume CD-ROM collection of material compiled by Stephen Jones for the exhibition formally known as Synthetics. Content is arranged in folders and as a collection of texts, images and hypertexts. The main folder contains material relating to the work of Stephen Jones. (see: Documentation for details)

results.title: Synthetics. Volume 3
results.brief_description: Volume 3 of a 4 volume CD-ROM collection of material compiled by Stephen Jones for the exhibition formally known as Synthetics. Content is arranged in folders and as a collection of texts, images and hypertexts. The folders contain material relating to the work of Warren Burt and the general Synthetics website. (see: Documentation for details)

results.title: Synthetics. Volume 2
results.brief_description: Volume 2 of a 4 volume CD-ROM collection of material compiled by Stephen Jones for the exhibition formally known as Synthetics. Content is arranged in folders and as a collection of texts, images and hypertexts. The folders contain material relating to the work of the following artists: Andrew Quinn, Ariel, David Chesworth, Doug Richardson, Iain MacLeod, Jeff Seidler, Jill Scott, Jon McCormack, Peter Callas, Sally Pryor, Tom Ellard and Wendy Spencer. (see: Documentation for details)
